com.github.bjarneh.parse.options
Class Getopt

java.lang.Object
  com.github.bjarneh.parse.options.Getopt

public class Getopt
extends Object

Getopt is a command line parser. Not a re-implementation of GNU-getopt. 


   // Typical use:

   Getopt getopt = new Getopt();

   getopt.addBoolOption("-h -help --help help");
   getopt.addBoolOption"("-v -version --version");

   // addFancyStrOption creates all variants of a flag, i.e.
   // these two statements are equivalent
   //
   // 1. getopt.addStrOption("-p -p= -port -port= --port --port=");
   // 
   // 2. getopt.addFancyStrOption("-p --port");

   getopt.addFancyStrOption("-p --port");
   getopt.addFancyStrOption("-r --root");
   getopt.addStrOption("-I -I=");

   String[] rest = getopt.parse(args);

   if(getopt.isSet("-help")){
     System.out.println(" I will help you ");
   }

   if(getopt.isSet("-port")){
     int port = getopt.getInt("-port");
   }

   if(getopt.isSet("-root")){
     String root = getopt.get("-root");
   }

   if(getopt.isSet("-I")){
     for(String i: getopt.getAll("-I")){
       System.out.printf(" -I: %s\n", i);
     }
   }

   for(String s: rest){
     System.out.printf("unparsed: %s\n", s);
   }

          Constructor alias for Getopt(true), ie die on error.

addStrOption

public void addStrOption(String flagStr)
Add a flag that expects options.

Parameters:
flagStr - white space separated flags

addFancyStrOption

public void addFancyStrOption(String flagStr)
Add a flag that expects options, this method automatically generates some flags for you. 
 addFancyStrOption("-f --file");
 // is equivalent to
 addStrOption("-f -f= -file -file= --file --file=");

Parameters:
flagStr - white space separated flags

parse

Parse arguments with options given.

Parameters:

Returns:
unparsed arguments

Returns:

get

public String get(String flag)
Return the argument of a string option.

Parameters:
flag - a flag belonging to a string option
Returns:
argument for option denoted by flag

getAll

public String[] getAll(String flag)
Return all argument for a string option. To give multiple arguments to a string option you need to give the flag multiple times, i.e. 
 -I/usr/lib -I/usr/share/lib   // OK
 -I /usr/lib /usr/share/lib    // NOT OK

Parameters:
flag - a flag belonging to a string option
Returns:
an array of arguments belonging to a string option

getInt

Return argument for a flag as an int.

Parameters:
flag - a flag belonging to a string option
Returns:
the argument of the flag converted to an int
